What economic uses to ducks have?	They are farmed for their meat, eggs and feathers. They are also kept and bred by aviculturists and often displayed in zoos.

What kind of ducks feed on land?	Dabbling ducks

What unrelated water birds are ducks sometimes confused with?	loons or divers, grebes, gallinules, and coots

What does the word duck mean?	It is the common name for a number of species in the Anatidae family of birds.
What does the word duck mean?	to bend down low as if to get under something
What are some common predators of ducks?	Pike, crocodilians, herons, hawks and eagles.
What are some common predators of ducks?	pike, crocodilians, and other aquatic hunters
How does a Mallard's tongue work?	It's tongue is a flat plate, and on the tongue's back end is a short liftable flap with about 18 short spikes for pushing struggling prey and other food down its throat
How does a Mallard's tongue work?	It uses short spikes to push struggling prey and other food down its throat

Why are ducklings particularly vulnerable?	Their inability to fly.
Why are ducklings particularly vulnerable?	their inability to fly makes them easy prey
What are some economic uses for duck?	Meat,eggs,feathers
What are some economic uses for duck?	being farmed for their meat, eggs, feathers, (particularly their down)
What allows a duck to filter water out of the side of their beaks and keep food inside?	Tiny rows of plates called lamellae
What allows a duck to filter water out of the side of their beaks and keep food inside?	tiny rows of plates called lamellae like a whale's baleen
What expression is part of a conceptual framework for testing computer systems?	Quacks like a duck

Where did the expression "a sitting duck" come from?	In many areas, wild duckof various species (including ducks farmed and released into the wild) are hunted for food or sport, by shooting, or formerly by decoys.
Where did the expression "a sitting duck" come from?	In many areas, wild ducks of various species (including ducks farmed and released into the wild) are hunted for food or sport, by shooting, or formerly by decoys.
